string.description: name of the Mirror
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate
Reference to an Interface resource to send the mirrored traffic to.  This must be on the same Node as the source.
Single value between 0-4094 support, or the special keyword untagged.

single_nested.description: Local destination for the mirror, there can only be either a remote destination or local destination provisioned for a Mirror.

string.description: Specifies the DefaultRouter to reach the remote destination of the mirror, a Router and DefaultRouter reference cannot be set at the same time.
Remote destination IP address.  When a remote destination is used for the mirror, the destinationIP is mandatory.
Specifies the Router to reach the remote destination of the mirror, a Router and DefaultRouter reference cannot be set at the same time.
Source IP to use when sending a mirror to a remote destination.  When a remote destination us used for the mirror, the sourceIP is mandatory.

single_nested.description: Remote destination for the mirror, there can only be either a remote destination or local destination provisioned for a Mirror.

string.description: The direction of the traffic being mirrored.
Description of the FilterEntry.
An action to take, either 'Accept','Drop', or 'RateLimit'.
Destination port to match by name.

int64.description: Destination port to match by numerical value.

string.description: Operator to use when matching destinationPort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
Range of destination ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200,  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
Destination prefix to match.

list.description: Match a specific ICMP code, as a number between 0-255, e.g. 0.

string.description: Match a specific ICMP type by name, e.g. dest-unreachable.

int64.description: Match a specific ICMP type by number.

bool.description: Log the matches for this entry.

string.description: Match a specific IP protocol name (specified in the type field of the IP header).

int64.description: Match a specific IP protocol number (specified in the type field of the IP header).
The maximum burst size in bytes.

bool.description: Controls policer instantiation: false for shared instance, true for per-entry instances

int64.description: The peak rate in kilobytes per second.

string.description: Determines how the policer is applied across subinterfaces. Global applies the policer across all subinterfaces, while Subinterface applies it individually to each subinterface.

single_nested.description: Rate limit to apply when the action is 'RateLimit'.

string.description: Source port to match by name.

int64.description: Source port to match by numerical value.

string.description: Operator to use when matching sourcePort, either Equals, GreaterOrEquals, or LessOrEquals.
Range of source ports to match, in the format n-m, e.g. 100-200.  The start and end of the range must be port numbers.
Source prefix to match.
Match TCP flags, usable with !, &, | and the flags RST, SYN, and ACK.
Type of the entry which can be IPV4, IPV6 or Auto.

list_nested.description: Specifies the list of filter entries, in order.

single_nested.description: Emittes an MirrorFilter and uses the filter as a source for the Mirror.

list.description: List of BridgeInterfaces, all traffic from all BridgeInterfaces in the list will be used as sources to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.

int64.description: Index of the sub-interface. This is ignored on a node running SROS.

string.description: Reference to an Interface resource, the combination of the Interface and the specified subinterface index will build the subinterface to be used as a source of traffic to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
Reference to the VLAN resource under which the sub-interface is configured. This is mandatory when the sub-interface is on a node running SROS and ignored for all other node operating systems.

list_nested.description: List of Interfaces and subinterface indices

list.description: List of VLAN resources, all subinterfaces attached to the VLAN will be used as sources to be mirrored.  A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.

single_nested.description: Subinterfaces on which to deploy the IPFilter to use as a source for the Mirror.

list.description: Select Interfaces using a label selector to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.  If both a label selector is used and a list of Interfaces is provided, a combination of all selected and provided interfaces will be mirrored.

List of Interfaces to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.  If both a label selector is used and a list of Interfaces is provided, a combination of all selected and provided interfaces will be mirrored.

single_nested.description: Reference to an Interface resource to be mirrored.  Traffic from the entire Interface will be mirrored for any selected Interfaces.

list.description: List of BridgeInterfaces, all traffic from all BridgeInterfaces in the list will be used as sources to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.

int64.description: Index of the sub-interface. This is ignored on a node running SROS.

string.description: Reference to an Interface resource, the combination of the Interface and the specified subinterface index will build the subinterface to be used as a source of traffic to be mirrored. A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.
Reference to the VLAN resource under which the sub-interface is configured. This is mandatory when the sub-interface is on a node running SROS and ignored for all other node operating systems.

list_nested.description: List of Interfaces and subinterface indices

list.description: List of VLAN resources, all subinterfaces attached to the VLAN will be used as sources to be mirrored.  A combination of VLANs, BridgeInterfaces and subinterfaces can be configured as sources together.

single_nested.description: Mirror sources.
Mirror allows for the configuration of mirroring sources, including interfaces, subinterfaces, and filters, as well as the destination for the mirrored traffic, which can be either local or remote.

string.description: Indicates when this SubInterface last changed state.
Mirror Identifier used as the name of the mirror.

int64.description: Total number of active Interfaces used as sources of the mirror.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV4Filter associations.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV6Filter associations.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from VLAN resource references.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from BridgeInterface resource references.

string.description: Indicates the current operational state of the Mirror instance.
Indicates what is driving the particular subinterface to be selected as a mirror source.
Node specific interface name.
Reference to Node object.
Operating System of the Node.

int64.description: Index allocated to the subinterface which is being mirrored. If an interface is used as a source, this will not be set.

string.description: vlan assigned to this subinterface.

list_nested.description: List of members in this Interface.

single_nested.description: MirrorStatus defines the observed state of Mirror

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate

string.description: name of the Ping
the namespace scope in which to operate

Address to ping.
This is a single IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) or a hostname that resolves to an IP address.

int64.description: Count is the number of pings to send.

string.description:
The network instance to use for the ping. This is the named network instance on the node, typically "default" or some other base name.
If not specified, the default network instance will be used, which is typically the main/default/global network interface on the node.

list.description:
List of selectors to select nodes to perform pings on.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources, including those TopoNodes in the list of nodes that pings will be performed on.
If no nodes are specified, and no node selectors are specified, all nodes in the given namespace will be selected.

List of nodes to perform pings from.
Items in the list should be the names of the nodes, where each node will have a ping performed on it.
If no nodes are specified, and no node selectors are specified, all nodes in the given namespace will be selected.

int64.description: TimeoutSeconds is the timeout for the ping in seconds.

single_nested.description: Ping allows a ping to be initiated to a specific address on node/set of nodes.

int64.description: Average time taken for a ping reply.
Maximum time taken for a ping reply.
Minimum time taken for a ping reply.
Number of pings received.
Number of pings sent.
Standard deviation of time taken for all pings.
Total time taken for all pings.

single_nested.description: Details of the ping result, if available.

string.description: Error message, if the ping failed.
Network instance used to source the ping from.
Node the ping was sourced from.

bool.description: Indicates if the ping was successful.

list_nested.description:
Details contains the results of the pings performed on each node.
Each entry in the list corresponds to a node that was pinged.

string.description:
Result is the overall result of the ping operation.
It can be one of the following values:
- "Success": All pings were successful.
- "Failed": No pings were successful.
- "PartialSuccess": Some pings were successful, but not all.

single_nested.description: PingStatus defines the observed state of Ping

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate

This is a single IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) or a hostname that resolves to an IP address.

If not specified, the default network instance will be used, which is typically the main/default/global network interface on the node.

string.description: name of the TechSupport
the namespace scope in which to operate

list.description:
List of node selectors to select nodes generate technical support packages for.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources.
If no nodes are specified, and no node selectors are specified, all nodes in the given namespace will be selected.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf"].
List of nodes to generate and collect technical support packages for.

single_nested.description: Generate technical support packages for a node or set of nodes.

int64.description: Id

string.description: Result

single_nested.description: Result of the technical support package generation.

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate

list.description:
List of node selectors to select nodes generate technical support packages for.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources.
If no nodes are specified, and no node selectors are specified, all nodes in the given namespace will be selected.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf"].
List of nodes to generate and collect technical support packages for.

single_nested.description: Generate technical support packages for a node or set of nodes.

int64.description: Id

string.description: Result

string.description: name of the Threshold
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate
The description of the alarm.
The probable cause of the alarm.
The remedial action for the alarm.

single_nested.description: Alarm details for this threshold.

string.description: Field to monitor for this threshold, for example `utilization`.

bool.description: Enable or disable generation of a topology overlay for this threshold.

string.description: The name of this threshold. This name will be used to generate the alarm name, so should follow CamelCase conventions, e.g. VolumeUtilization.

Path to monitor for this threshold. This should be the full EDB path to the table containing the field you wish to trigger a threshold on.
For example, to monitor the utilization field of the component volume table, you would use `.namespace.node.normal.components_eda_nokia_com.v1.controlmodule.volume`, and set field to `utilization`.
The group of the resource to monitor.
The kind of resource to monitor.
The name of the resource to monitor.

single_nested.description:
Which resource to associate with this threshold. This overrides the destination resource in alarms raised as a result of threshold breaches.
By default a resource will attempt to be derived based on the monitored path.

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a critical alarm.
This value must be greater than the majorThreshold.

The delta value for clearing a threshold.
For example, with a critical threshold of 90, direction of Rising and a delta of 5, the critical alarm will clear when the utilization drops below 85.

string.description: Direction of the threshold: "Rising" or "Falling".

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a major alarm.
This value must be greater than the minorThreshold.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a minor alarm.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a warning alarm.

single_nested.description: Severities and their associated values.

A Threshold allows you to monitor a field in EDB and trigger severity-correct alarms based on the value of that field.
By using EDB as a source you are able to trigger thresholds on any published field from a TopoNode, or any other EDB source.
ThresholdStatus defines the observed state of Threshold

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate
The description of the alarm.
The probable cause of the alarm.
The remedial action for the alarm.

single_nested.description: Alarm details for this threshold.

string.description: Field to monitor for this threshold, for example `utilization`.

bool.description: Enable or disable generation of a topology overlay for this threshold.

string.description: The name of this threshold. This name will be used to generate the alarm name, so should follow CamelCase conventions, e.g. VolumeUtilization.

Path to monitor for this threshold. This should be the full EDB path to the table containing the field you wish to trigger a threshold on.
For example, to monitor the utilization field of the component volume table, you would use `.namespace.node.normal.components_eda_nokia_com.v1.controlmodule.volume`, and set field to `utilization`.
The group of the resource to monitor.
The kind of resource to monitor.
The name of the resource to monitor.

single_nested.description:
Which resource to associate with this threshold. This overrides the destination resource in alarms raised as a result of threshold breaches.
By default a resource will attempt to be derived based on the monitored path.

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a critical alarm.
This value must be greater than the majorThreshold.

The delta value for clearing a threshold.
For example, with a critical threshold of 90, direction of Rising and a delta of 5, the critical alarm will clear when the utilization drops below 85.

string.description: Direction of the threshold: "Rising" or "Falling".

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a major alarm.
This value must be greater than the minorThreshold.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a minor alarm.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a warning alarm.

single_nested.description: Severities and their associated values.

A Threshold allows you to monitor a field in EDB and trigger severity-correct alarms based on the value of that field.
By using EDB as a source you are able to trigger thresholds on any published field from a TopoNode, or any other EDB source.
ThresholdStatus defines the observed state of Threshold

Mirror allows for the configuration of mirroring sources, including interfaces, subinterfaces, and filters, as well as the destination for the mirrored traffic, which can be either local or remote.

Mirror Identifier used as the name of the mirror.

int64.description: Total number of active Interfaces used as sources of the mirror.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV4Filter associations.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from IPV6Filter associations.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from VLAN resource references.
Total number of active subinterfaces used as sources of the mirror derived from BridgeInterface resource references.

string.description: Indicates the current operational state of the Mirror instance.
Indicates what is driving the particular subinterface to be selected as a mirror source.
Node specific interface name.
Reference to Node object.
Operating System of the Node.

int64.description: Index allocated to the subinterface which is being mirrored. If an interface is used as a source, this will not be set.

string.description: vlan assigned to this subinterface.

list_nested.description: List of members in this Interface.

single_nested.description: MirrorStatus defines the observed state of Mirror

string.description: name of the Mirror
the namespace scope in which to operate
The description of the alarm.
The probable cause of the alarm.
The remedial action for the alarm.

single_nested.description: Alarm details for this threshold.

string.description: Field to monitor for this threshold, for example `utilization`.

bool.description: Enable or disable generation of a topology overlay for this threshold.

string.description: The name of this threshold. This name will be used to generate the alarm name, so should follow CamelCase conventions, e.g. VolumeUtilization.

Path to monitor for this threshold. This should be the full EDB path to the table containing the field you wish to trigger a threshold on.
For example, to monitor the utilization field of the component volume table, you would use `.namespace.node.normal.components_eda_nokia_com.v1.controlmodule.volume`, and set field to `utilization`.
The group of the resource to monitor.
The kind of resource to monitor.
The name of the resource to monitor.

single_nested.description:
Which resource to associate with this threshold. This overrides the destination resource in alarms raised as a result of threshold breaches.
By default a resource will attempt to be derived based on the monitored path.

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a critical alarm.
This value must be greater than the majorThreshold.

The delta value for clearing a threshold.
For example, with a critical threshold of 90, direction of Rising and a delta of 5, the critical alarm will clear when the utilization drops below 85.

string.description: Direction of the threshold: "Rising" or "Falling".

int64.description:
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a major alarm.
This value must be greater than the minorThreshold.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a minor alarm.
The minimum average utilization over the last 1 minute to trigger a warning alarm.

single_nested.description: Severities and their associated values.

A Threshold allows you to monitor a field in EDB and trigger severity-correct alarms based on the value of that field.
By using EDB as a source you are able to trigger thresholds on any published field from a TopoNode, or any other EDB source.
ThresholdStatus defines the observed state of Threshold

string.description: name of the Threshold
the namespace scope in which to operate
